item.title: Join the lab
Publications
item.description: GoogleScholar – ResearcherID E-2439-2012 – ResearchGate Journal articles - Book chapters - Miscellaneous Peer-reviewed journal articles preprint - in press - 2021 - 2020 - 2019 - 2018 - 2017 - 2016 - 2015 - 2014 - 2013 - 2012 - pre 2012 - in revision preprint 49 – Karger DN, Saladin B, Wüest-Karpati RO, Graham CH, Zurell D, Mo L, Zimmermann NE (2021) Interannual climate variability data improves niche estimates in species distribution models.

Lab alumni Postdocs 2019-2021 – Christian König (PhD) - BIOPIC project, work package “Understanding how biotic interactions shape species’ niches” 2018-2020 – Patrice Descombes (PhD) – WSL, SPEEDMIND project – Improve feedback between biodiversity analyses and citizen scientists, main Supervisor: Prof. Dr. Niklaus E. Zimmermann (WSL, Switzerland) Research assistants 2020-2021 – Simon Kapitza (M.Sc.) - Univ. Potsdam – data base management, biodiversity assessments, socio-economic modelling 2020-2021 – Yari Osenberg (M.

item.title: Open thesis topics
item.description: Intra-specific variation in dispersal: a simulation approach (Master thesis) Dynamic occupancy modelling of Swiss breeding birds (Master thesis) Climate change-induced niche shifts in North American birds (Master thesis) Climatic niche asymmetry in plants of the Americas (Master thesis) Intra-specific variation in dispersal: a simulation approach (Master thesis) Dispersal is a central biological process determining the movement and genetic exchange between populations, and the range dynamics of species under global change.

item.title: Damaris Zurell
item.description: Contact - Education - Career - Projects - Awards - Professional activities - Memberships Contact details Prof. Dr. Damaris Zurell Ecology/Macroecology Group Institute for Biochemistry and Biology | University of Potsdam Am Neuen Palais 10 | D-14469 Potsdam | Germany Office: Maulbeerallee 3 | D-14469 Potsdam | Room 0.12 Phone: +49 331 977 191002 Education 2011 – PhD in Geoecology, University of Potsdam, Inst. of Earth and Environmental Sciences

item.title: Downloads
item.description: You can download some of my codes from my github site. Repository IBM_OptimalForaging C++ codes for individual-based foraging model described in Zurell et al. (2015) Oikos. Repository Rcodes_MapNovelEnvironments_SDMs R codes for mapping novel environments (SDM inflated response curves and environmental overlap masks) described in Zurell et al. (2012) DDI.
